item.title: Flutter Tutorial - Development Environment Setup
item.author: Author
item.description: I have dabbled with Dart for some toy backend experiment when it first came out years ago, even before ES6 era. I really liked how it was typed and offer very nice IDE integrations, as well as its Stream support. With Flutter overtaking React Native on Google Trends, I decided to dive head first and try to make a cross platform toy app that can run on iOS, Android and Web.

item.title: Messy UI? Here Is A Solution
item.author: Author
item.description: Have you ever heard a designer telling a developer: Designer says Your margin on this widget is 3 pixels off. The font size on this button is too big. The font color is not right shade. The text didn’t change color when hovering over the button. The designer have to make sure his design is always consistent, or else the developer is going to implement it inconsistently. The designer will have to double check the developer’s work to ensure the final product is correct.

item.title: Optimize Graphql Query Performance Using Data Loader
item.author: Author
item.description: While working on a project for a client, we came across an interesting twist to a common problem. We were tasked with making the API backend that powers a mobile app called Playhouse, a mobile app that displays real estate listings to its users in a nice little video package. We decided to make a GraphQL API and got to building. During the design process, we made a point of keeping it maintainable for the long run.
